statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Wofford 91, Cincinnati 90
article.story: CINCINNATI (AP) -- Senior Eric Marshall scored 27 points, including four 3-pointers, to help Wofford stun Cincinnati 91-90 in the first-ever meeting between the two schools. Shane Nichols added 20 points for the Terriers who defeated a Big East opponent for just the second time in program history. Freshman Deonta Vaughn, making his first start for the Bearcats, led all scorers with 33 points including 22 in the first half. He went 9-of-17 on 3-pointers. With the game tied at 90, Nichols hit one of two free throws to give Wofford a one-point lead with 5.7 seconds remaining. Vaughn's potential game-winning shot caromed off the rim at the buzzer giving Wofford the win. Wofford (4-1) has won four consecutive games since losing 92-88 at North Carolina State in the season opener. Marcus Sikes added 20 points for Cincinnati (3-1). Both teams shot 53 percent from 3-point range in the first half. Wofford grabbed an 18-14 early lead, hitting 4-of-5 3-pointers. The Bearcats responded with five consecutive three-point shots, including four by Vaughn, to pull ahead 29-18. The Terriers pulled to a 33-32 lead after a 3-pointer by Corey Godzinski completed a 12-0 Wofford run. The score was tied at 55 when Nichols converted two free throws following a technical foul on Bearcats head coach Mick Cronin. Wofford led by nine points with 3:59 remaining in the game before the Bearcats rallied to tie the score. Cincinnati head football coach Mark Dantonio, who led the Bearcats to an upset win over undefeated No. 7 Rutgers on Saturday, was honored at halftime. The Terriers' only other victory over a Big East team was in 2002 when it defeated Virginia Tech.
